Key Match Events: Youri Tielemans scored Belgium's early opening goal after 73 seconds
Kevin De Bruyne scored Belgium's second goal after 80 minutes
Romelu Lukaku had a third goal of the tournament overturned by VAR
VAR intervened to overturn Belgium's second goal
Pre-Game Insights: Domenico Tedesco displayed a pragmatic approach
Belgium manager was happy with the team's performance in the opening game despite the loss
Belgium made four changes, including restoring Jan Vertonghen to defense and adding the more progressive Tielemans alongside Amadou Onana in midfield
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium manager expressed relief at winning the game but was not happy with missing chances
Tedesco's team showed an electric performance but missed some chances
Belgium could not have played as they did without Romelu Lukaku on the field
Belgium's support was jubilant at the end of the match
Belgium's mentality for the match was good according to Tedesco
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lukaku passed up a series of presentable chances
